column4: how can I check if the nvidia driver is installed and working??
a big splash screen with nvidia logo comes up when installed at boot up
the logo comes up, but i ran a little game (tux racer or something like that) to check it, and it was ver very slow
any idea of whats going on?
where did you install the drivers from?
in the help guide that comes with ubuntu.
nvidia-glx drivers I take it...they should work fine..so I'm not sure really
Sanne's hint was a good one
Sanne said to lsmod | grep nvidia
i'll try it
lsmod | grep nvidia   gives me      nvidia               3711364  12
agpgart                32328  2 nvidia,via_agp
what does that mean?
that would indicate that they are loaded I would say
erUSUL_, thanks
I was curious because the way i've always installed the driver i had to download it from nvidia's web site and a lot of other thigs
what do you think?
the nvidia-glx drivers in synaptic support hardware acceleration so I would think they would work
if you think that they are not doing so then you can get the nvidia drivers from the nvidia site if you feel so inclined
ill try theese , thanks for your time
ok
